bibl.title: Letter from Lewis J. Moorman to Philip Showalter Hench, March 12, 1946

div1.p: Moorman requests that Hench examine a document about Walter Reed and comment on its accuracy.

div1.head: Letter from Lewis J. Moorman to Philip Showalter Hench, March 12, 1946
div1.opener:
Farm Sanatorium
50th and North Walker
L. J. Moorman, Med. Dir.
Office
304 Osler Building
1200 North Walker
LEWIS J. MOORMAN, M. D.
OKLAHOMA CITY 3, OKLAHOMA
March 12, 1946
Dr. Phillip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
In Chicago last week I was talking to our mutual
friend, Jimmy Waring of Denver, and told him that I had recently
looked up certain facts concerning Walter Reed's work on yellow
fever. I knew of your intensive studies, but I did not think of
troubling you with this brief discussion until after my conversa-
tion with Dr. Waring. I am enclosing a poor copy, the only one
I have available now. If you will do me the kindness of looking
it over with reference to accuracy of statements and any marginal
comments you may desire to make, I shall greatly appreciate it.
Please feel perfectly free to criticise.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely, Lewis J. Moorman, M.D. LJM:rjl
Encl.
